title: Your First HTML Page
description: Learn the basics of HTML and create your first web page element

steps.title: Step 1: What is HTML?
steps.content:
HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is the language that builds every website you visit. It tells your web browser what to display on the screen.

HTML works by using **tags** - special codes that label different parts of your page. Every tag you write tells the browser: "this is a title" or "this is a paragraph" or "this is a link."

üåê What you type (HTML code):

task.question: What does HTML stand for?
task.hint: Think about what the 'HT' in HTML might represent. It's about linking documents together on the web!

steps.title: Step 2: Opening and Closing Tags
steps.content:
Every HTML tag has TWO parts that work together: **Opening Tag** = `

` - This STARTS the element - Has angle brackets: `< >` - Contains the tag name: `h1` - NO forward slash **Closing Tag** = `

` - This ENDS the element - Has angle brackets: `< >` - Contains a forward slash: `/` - Same tag name: `h1` The browser reads everything between the opening and closing tags as belonging to that element. The `/` tells the browser "this element is finished now."

steps.title: Step 3: Where Do Headers Go in Real HTML?
steps.content:
Headers are titles on your webpage. Think of a webpage like a document with sections - the **h1 tag goes at the very top** as the main title. **HTML documents have a structure:** 1. `` = The container for the entire page 2. `` = The visible part people see 3. `

` = The main title (goes INSIDE the body) 4. `

` = Paragraphs (also go inside the body) Your h1 tag lives inside the body tag. The body tag contains everything users see on the screen.
steps.visual:
üìÑ Complete HTML Document Structure:
<html> ‚Üê Starts the webpage
<body> ‚Üê Visible content area
‚Üê THIS IS WHERE h1 GOES
<h1>My Page Title</h1>
<p>This is a paragraph</p>
<h2>Section Title</h2>
<p>Another paragraph</p>
</body> ‚Üê Ends visible area
</html> ‚Üê Ends webpage
üí° The h1 tag is the FIRST thing inside <body> - it's your page title that people see at the top!

task.question: Where does the <h1> tag belong in an HTML document?

options.text: Inside the <body> tag, usually at the top
At the very end of the document

task.hint: Remember: <h1> goes inside <body>, which is the visible part of your webpage!
